member.name: F:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Connectors.OpenAI.ClientCore.MaxInflightAutoInvokes
member.summary: The maximum number of auto-invokes that can be in-flight at any given time as part of the current asynchronous chain of execution.
member.remarks: This is a fail-safe mechanism. If someone accidentally manages to set up execution settings in such a way that auto-invocation is invoked recursively, and in particular where a prompt function is able to auto-invoke itself, we could end up in an infinite loop. This const is a backstop against that happening. We should never come close to this limit, but if we do, auto-invoke will be disabled for the current flow in order to prevent runaway execution. With the current setup, the way this could possibly happen is if a prompt function is configured with built-in execution settings that opt-in to auto-invocation of everything in the kernel, in which case the invocation of that prompt function could advertize itself as a candidate for auto-invocation. We don't want to outright block that, if that's something a developer has asked to do (e.g. it might be invoked with different arguments than its parent was invoked with), but we do want to limit it. This limit is arbitrary and can be tweaked in the future and/or made configurable should need arise.

member.summary: The format of the transcript output, in one of these options: json, srt, verbose_json, or vtt. Default is 'json'.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Connectors.OpenAI.OpenAIAudioToTextExecutionSettings.Temperature
member.summary: The sampling temperature, between 0 and 1. Higher values like 0.8 will make the output more random, while lower values like 0.2 will make it more focused and deterministic. If set to 0, the model will use log probability to automatically increase the temperature until certain thresholds are hit. Default is 0.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Connectors.OpenAI.OpenAIAudioToTextExecutionSettings.TimestampGranularities
member.summary: The timestamp granularities to populate for this transcription. response_format must be set verbose_json to use timestamp granularities. Either or both of these options are supported: word, or segment.
member.remarks: There is no additional latency for segment timestamps, but generating word timestamps incurs additional latency.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Connectors.OpenAI.OpenAIPromptExecutionSettings
member.summary: Execution settings for an OpenAI completion request.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Connectors.OpenAI.OpenAIPromptExecutionSettings.ReasoningEffort
member.summary: Gets or sets an object specifying the effort level for the model to use when generating the completion.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Connectors.OpenAI.OpenAIPromptExecutionSettings.Temperature
member.summary: Temperature controls the randomness of the completion. The higher the temperature, the more random the completion. Default is 1.0.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Connectors.OpenAI.OpenAIPromptExecutionSettings.TopP
member.summary: TopP controls the diversity of the completion. The higher the TopP, the more diverse the completion. Default is 1.0.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Connectors.OpenAI.OpenAIPromptExecutionSettings.PresencePenalty
member.summary: Number between -2.0 and 2.0. Positive values penalize new tokens based on whether they appear in the text so far, increasing the model's likelihood to talk about new topics.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Connectors.OpenAI.OpenAIPromptExecutionSettings.FrequencyPenalty
member.summary: Number between -2.0 and 2.0. Positive values penalize new tokens based on their existing frequency in the text so far, decreasing the model's likelihood to repeat the same line verbatim.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Connectors.OpenAI.OpenAIPromptExecutionSettings.MaxTokens
member.summary: The maximum number of tokens to generate in the completion.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Connectors.OpenAI.OpenAIPromptExecutionSettings.StopSequences
member.summary: Sequences where the completion will stop generating further tokens.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Connectors.OpenAI.OpenAIPromptExecutionSettings.Seed
member.summary: If specified, the system will make a best effort to sample deterministically such that repeated requests with the same seed and parameters should return the same result. Determinism is not guaranteed.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Connectors.OpenAI.OpenAIPromptExecutionSettings.ResponseFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets the response format to use for the completion.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Connectors.OpenAI.OpenAIPromptExecutionSettings.ChatSystemPrompt
member.summary: The system prompt to use when generating text using a chat model. Defaults to "Assistant is a large language model."

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Connectors.OpenAI.OpenAIPromptExecutionSettings.ChatDeveloperPrompt
member.summary: The system prompt to use when generating text using a chat model. Defaults to "Assistant is a large language model."

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Connectors.OpenAI.OpenAIPromptExecutionSettings.TokenSelectionBiases
member.summary: Modify the likelihood of specified tokens appearing in the completion.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Connectors.OpenAI.OpenAIPromptExecutionSettings.ToolCallBehavior
member.summary: Gets or sets the behavior for how tool calls are handled.
member.remarks:
To disable all tool calling, set the property to null (the default).
To request that the model use a specific function, set the property to an instance returned from .
To allow the model to request one of any number of functions, set the property to an instance returned from , called with a list of the functions available.
To allow the model to request one of any of the functions in the supplied , set the property to if the client should simply send the information about the functions and not handle the response in any special manner, or if the client should attempt to automatically invoke the function and send the result back to the service.
For all options where an instance is provided, auto-invoke behavior may be selected. If the service sends a request for a function call, if auto-invoke has been requested, the client will attempt to resolve that function from the functions available in the , and if found, rather than returning the response back to the caller, it will handle the request automatically, invoking the function, and sending back the result. The intermediate messages will be retained in the if an instance was provided.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Connectors.OpenAI.OpenAIPromptExecutionSettings.User
member.summary: A unique identifier representing your end-user, which can help OpenAI to monitor and detect abuse

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Connectors.OpenAI.OpenAIPromptExecutionSettings.Logprobs
member.summary: Whether to return log probabilities of the output tokens or not. If true, returns the log probabilities of each output token returned in the `content` of `message`.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Connectors.OpenAI.OpenAIPromptExecutionSettings.TopLogprobs
member.summary: An integer specifying the number of most likely tokens to return at each token position, each with an associated log probability.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Connectors.OpenAI.OpenAIPromptExecutionSettings.Metadata
member.summary: Developer-defined tags and values used for filtering completions in the OpenAI dashboard.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Connectors.OpenAI.OpenAIPromptExecutionSettings.Store
member.summary: Whether or not to store the output of this chat completion request for use in the OpenAI model distillation or evals products.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Connectors.OpenAI.OpenAIPromptExecutionSettings.WebSearchOptions
member.summary: An object to allow models to search the web for the latest information before generating a response.
member.remarks:
Supported types are:
- object;
- , which will be used to automatically deserialize into .
- , which will be used to automatically deserialize into .
Currently, you need to use one of these models to use web search in Chat Completions:
gpt-4o-search-preview
gpt-4o-mini-search-preview

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Connectors.OpenAI.OpenAIPromptExecutionSettings.Modalities
member.summary: Gets or sets the response modalities to use for the completion.
member.remarks:
Specifies the modalities to use for the response. This can be represented in several ways:
As a flags enum: ChatResponseModalities.Text | ChatResponseModalities.Audio
As an of modality names: new[] { "text", "audio" }
As a representation: "Text, Audio"
As a containing either a string or an array of strings
If this property is null, will be used, which typically means text-only responses. When audio is enabled, you should also set the property.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Connectors.OpenAI.OpenAIPromptExecutionSettings.Audio
member.summary: Gets or sets the audio options to use for the completion when audio modality is enabled.
member.remarks:
Use this property to configure the output audio voice and format when the property includes audio. This can be represented in several ways:
As a object: new ChatAudioOptions(ChatOutputAudioVoice.Alloy, ChatOutputAudioFormat.Mp3)
As a containing the serialized audio options
As a containing the JSON representation of the audio options

member.summary: Optional width and height of the generated image.

list.item: Must be one of 256x256, 512x512, or 1024x1024 for dall-e-2 model.
Must be one of 1024x1024, 1792x1024, 1024x1792 for dall-e-3 model.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Connectors.OpenAI.OpenAITextToImageExecutionSettings.Quality
member.summary: The quality of the image that will be generated.
member.remarks:
Must be one of standard or hd or high.
standard: creates images with standard quality. This is the default.
hd OR high: creates images with finer details and greater consistency.
This param is only supported for dall-e-3 model.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Connectors.OpenAI.OpenAITextToImageExecutionSettings.Style
member.summary: The style of the generated images.
member.remarks:
Must be one of vivid or natural.
vivid: causes the model to lean towards generating hyper-real and dramatic images.
natural: causes the model to produce more natural, less hyper-real looking images.
This param is only supported for dall-e-3 model.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Connectors.OpenAI.OpenAITextToImageExecutionSettings.ResponseFormat
member.summary:
The format of the generated images. Can be a or a string where:
: causes the model to generated in the provided format
url OR uri: causes the model to return an url for the generated images.
b64_json or bytes: causes the model to return in a Base64 format the content of the images.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Connectors.OpenAI.ToolCallBehavior
member.summary: Represents a behavior for OpenAI tool calls.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Connectors.OpenAI.ToolCallBehavior.DefaultMaximumAutoInvokeAttempts
member.summary: The default maximum number of tool-call auto-invokes that can be made in a single request.
member.remarks: After this number of iterations as part of a single user request is reached, auto-invocation will be disabled (e.g. will behave like )). This is a safeguard against possible runaway execution if the model routinely re-requests the same function over and over. It is currently hardcoded, but in the future it could be made configurable by the developer. Other configuration is also possible in the future, such as a delegate on the instance that can be invoked upon function call failure (e.g. failure to find the requested function, failure to invoke the function, etc.), with behaviors for what to do in such a case, e.g. respond to the model telling it to try again. With parallel tool call support, where the model can request multiple tools in a single response, it is significantly less likely that this limit is reached, as most of the time only a single request is needed.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Connectors.OpenAI.ToolCallBehavior.EnableKernelFunctions
member.summary: Gets an instance that will provide all of the 's plugins' function information. Function call requests from the model will be propagated back to the caller.
member.remarks: If no is available, no function information will be provided to the model.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Connectors.OpenAI.ToolCallBehavior.AutoInvokeKernelFunctions
member.summary: Gets an instance that will both provide all of the 's plugins' function information to the model and attempt to automatically handle any function call requests.
member.remarks: When successful, tool call requests from the model become an implementation detail, with the service handling invoking any requested functions and supplying the results back to the model. If no is available, no function information will be provided to the model.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Connectors.OpenAI.ToolCallBehavior.EnableFunctions(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Connectors.OpenAI.OpenAIFunction},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets an instance that will provide the specified list of functions to the model.
member.param: The functions that should be made available to the model.
true to attempt to automatically handle function call requests; otherwise, false.
member.returns: The that may be set into to indicate that the specified functions should be made available to the model.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Connectors.OpenAI.ToolCallBehavior.RequireFunction(Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Connectors.OpenAI.OpenAIFunction,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets an instance that will request the model to use the specified function.
member.param: The function the model should request to use.
true to attempt to automatically handle function call requests; otherwise, false.
member.returns: The that may be set into to indicate that the specified function should be requested by the model.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Connectors.OpenAI.ToolCallBehavior.#ctor(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes the instance; prevents external instantiation.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Connectors.OpenAI.ToolCallBehavior.ToolCallResultSerializerOptions
member.summary: Options to control tool call result serialization behavior.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Connectors.OpenAI.ToolCallBehavior.MaximumUseAttempts
member.summary: Gets how many requests are part of a single interaction should include this tool in the request.
member.remarks: This should be greater than or equal to . It defaults to . Once this limit is reached, the tools will no longer be included in subsequent retries as part of the operation, e.g. if this is 1, the first request will include the tools, but the subsequent response sending back the tool's result will not include the tools for further use.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Connectors.OpenAI.ToolCallBehavior.MaximumAutoInvokeAttempts
member.summary: Gets how many tool call request/response roundtrips are supported with auto-invocation.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Connectors.OpenAI.ToolCallBehavior.EnabledFunctions
member.summary: Represents a that provides a specified list of functions to the model.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Connectors.OpenAI.ToolCallBehavior.RequiredFunction
member.summary: Represents a that requests the model use a specific function.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Connectors.OpenAI.ToolCallBehavior.RequiredFunction.MaximumUseAttempts
member.summary: Gets how many requests are part of a single interaction should include this tool in the request.
member.remarks: Unlike and , this must use 1 as the maximum use attempts. Otherwise, every call back to the model _requires_ it to invoke the function (as opposed to allows it), which means we end up doing the same work over and over and over until the maximum is reached. Thus for "requires", we must send the tool information only once.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Connectors.FunctionCalling.FunctionCallsProcessor
member.summary: Class responsible for providing function calling configuration and processing AI function calls. As part of the processing, it will: 1. Iterate over items representing AI model function calls in the collection. 2. Look up each function in the . 3. Invoke the auto function invocation filter, if registered, for each function. 4. Invoke each function and add the function result to the .

member.name: F:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Connectors.FunctionCalling.FunctionCallsProcessor.MaxInflightAutoInvokes
member.summary: The maximum number of auto-invokes that can be in-flight at any given time as part of the current asynchronous chain of execution.
member.remarks: This is a fail-safe mechanism. If someone accidentally manages to set up execution settings in such a way that auto-invocation is invoked recursively, and in particular where a prompt function is able to auto-invoke itself, we could end up in an infinite loop. This const is a backstop against that happening. We should never come close to this limit, but if we do, auto-invoke will be disabled for the current flow in order to prevent runaway execution. With the current setup, the way this could possibly happen is if a prompt function is configured with built-in execution settings that opt-in to auto-invocation of everything in the kernel, in which case the invocation of that prompt function could advertize itself as a candidate for auto-invocation. We don't want to outright block that, if that's something a developer has asked to do (e.g. it might be invoked with different arguments than its parent was invoked with), but we do want to limit it. This limit is arbitrary and can be tweaked in the future and/or made configurable should need arise.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Connectors.FunctionCalling.FunctionCallsProcessor.MaximumAutoInvokeAttempts
member.summary: The maximum number of function auto-invokes that can be made in a single user request.
member.remarks: After this number of iterations as part of a single user request is reached, auto-invocation will be disabled. This is a safeguard against possible runaway execution if the model routinely re-requests the same function over and over.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Connectors.FunctionCalling.FunctionCallsProcessor.s_inflightAutoInvokes
member.summary: Tracking for .
member.remarks: It is temporarily made internal to allow code that uses the old function model to read it and decide whether to continue auto-invocation or not. It should be made private when the old model is deprecated. Despite the field being static, its value is unique per execution flow. So if thousands of requests hit it in parallel, each request will see its unique value.

member.summary: This method will execute auto function invocation filters and function recursively. If there are no registered filters, just function will be executed. member.name: T:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Diagnostics.ModelDiagnostics
member.summary: Model diagnostics helper class that provides a set of methods to trace model activities with the OTel semantic conventions. This class contains experimental features and may change in the future. To enable these features, set one of the following switches to true: `Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Experimental.GenAI.EnableOTelDiagnostics` `Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Experimental.GenAI.EnableOTelDiagnosticsSensitive` Or set the following environment variables to true: `SEMANTICKERNEL_EXPERIMENTAL_GENAI_ENABLE_OTEL_DIAGNOSTICS` `SEMANTICKERNEL_EXPERIMENTAL_GENAI_ENABLE_OTEL_DIAGNOSTICS_SENSITIVE`

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DynamicallyAccessedMembersAttribute
member.summary: Polyfill for the DynamicallyAccessedMembersAttribute not available in .NET Standard 2.0. Indicates that certain members on a specified are accessed dynamically, for example through .
member.remarks:
This allows tools to understand which members are being accessed during the execution of a program.
This attribute is valid on members whose type is or .
When this attribute is applied to a location of type , the assumption is that the string represents a fully qualified type name.
When this attribute is applied to a class, interface, or struct, the members specified can be accessed dynamically on instances returned from calling on instances of that class, interface, or struct.
If the attribute is applied to a method it's treated as a special case and it implies the attribute should be applied to the "this" parameter of the method. As such the attribute should only be used on instance methods of types assignable to System.Type (or string, but no methods will use it there).

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.UnconditionalSuppressMessageAttribute.Target
member.summary: Gets or sets a fully qualified path that represents the target of the attribute.
member.remarks: The property is an optional argument identifying the analysis target of the attribute. An example value is "System.IO.Stream.ctor():System.Void". Because it is fully qualified, it can be long, particularly for targets such as parameters. The analysis tool user interface should be capable of automatically formatting the parameter.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.UnconditionalSuppressMessageAttribute.MessageId
member.summary: Gets or sets an optional argument expanding on exclusion criteria.
member.remarks: The property is an optional argument that specifies additional exclusion where the literal metadata target is not sufficiently precise. For example, the cannot be applied within a method, and it may be desirable to suppress a violation against a statement in the method that will give a rule violation, but not against all statements in the method.
